data.title: Kareena Kapoor Shares Why Marriage With Saif Is 'Tough', Jokingly Says Hubby Takes Her For Granted
data.meta_description: Kareena Kapoor Khan revealed why she thinks her husband, Saif Ali Khan, has taken her for granted and talked about her 'tough' marriage with him.
data.text:
Kareena Kapoor Khan, a.k.a. Bebo, is one such Bollywood star who, even after years in showbiz, still mesmerises the audience with her top-notch performances. Since the 2000s, the 43-year-old has been known not just for her acting skills but also for her candid self. Recently, Kareena spoke at length about her professional and personal life in an interview.

advertisement

Kareena Kapoor shares what it is like to be married to another actor

Bebo turned muse for The Week's July edition as she completed 25 years in the industry. During her interaction, she shared what it is like to be married to another actor. For the unversed, Kareena got married to Saif Ali Khan in 2012. Later, the couple welcomed their two sons, Taimur and Jeh. While answering the question, the actress said that it is definitely tough being married to another actor. She said:

"It’s very tough (being married to an actor). Sometimes, he’s sleeping when I’ve left for work. I won’t see him living in the same house; we’re trying to take time out for the kids. Two actors in the same house."

Recommended Read: Mohammed Shami Finally Addresses Rumours Of His Marriage With Sania Mirza, 'Zabardasti Kiya Hai...'

advertisement

advertisement

Kareena Kapoor says that her husband, Saif, has taken her for granted

Continuing her statement, Kareena highlighted that her life has gotten better, and she has changed for good ever since she tied the knot with Saif. The 43-year-old added that her husband keeps her grounded whenever she starts to act a bit crazy. Moreover, the actress also mentioned that both of them sought each other's advice on various things.

advertisement

Kareena shared that she asks her husband for advice, and he does that, too. However, she isn't sure if Saif has ever implemented her ideas. She further stated that Saif hadn't seen her most recent release, Crew, co-starring Tabu and Kriti Sanon, owing to his busy shoot schedule. Saying that Saif has taken her for granted, Kareena added:

advertisement

“I always ask him for advice, and he does (ask me, too). I don’t know if he takes my advice. I am critical of his films. He hasn’t seen Crew, can you believe it? He’s been shooting, so see. But I have to see all his films…so in that sense, yeah, he’s taken me for granted this time."

Don't Miss: Payal Malik Supports Armaan And Kritika After Their Alleged Intimate Video From 'BB OTT 3' Surfaced

advertisement.

Kareena Kapoor talks about how only female actors are asked about 'comebacks' after marriage and kids

In the same conversation, Kareena Kapoor discussed comebacks in the industry. The actress, who started out in the industry with J.P. Dutta's 2000 film Refugee, has worked in nearly 70 movies to date. She asked a very thought-provoking question about why 'comebacks' are associated with only female actors and not men. Sharing that she felt equal to her male counterparts, Kareena said:

"Today, I don’t feel any less than my male counterparts. What does ‘comeback’ mean? Male stars don’t have comebacks, why do only female stars do? I am married and have two children but so do a lot of male actors in the industry."

advertisement

advertisement

What do you think of Kareena Kapoor Khan's candid revelations about her marriage with Saif Ali Khan?
